stimulusHtml: Which statement about the power of a significance test is true?
choicesHtml: A test performed at a significance level of α=0.01 has a higher power than the same test performed at a significance level of α=0.05.
If the probability of Type I error is decreased, the power of the test is increased.
The power of a test is equal to the probability of making a Type II error.
The power of a test is independent of the sample size.
The power of a test at a particular parameter value increases as the distance from the hypothesized value to the parameter value increases.
